properties.headline: !Disregard But Do Not Delete! - BROKEN HILL Blende Street
Triathlon - Sunday 16 February - WOY WOY McMasters Rd at Blackwell Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,500 people will take part in the Woy Woy Kids TRY-athlon held at various Woy Woy venues including the Peninsula Leisure Centre, James Browne Oval and local roads from 9am until 12pm midday.

Road closures will be in place from 7am until 1pm on McMasters Rd between Blackwall Rd and Ocean Beach Rd and on Welcome St between McMasters Rd and Alpha St. Local detours will be in place. Access to McMasters Rd at Blackwall Rd will also be restricted. 

Motorists should allow additional travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and follow the direction of traffic controllers.

properties.headline: Rugby 7's - Saturday 1 and Sunday 2 February - PARRAMATTA O'Connell St at Victoria Rd
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on trains. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Bankwest Stadium event day road closures and detour routes

properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Rugby 7's at Bankwest Stadium on Saturday and Sunday at Bankwest Stadium.

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time of the final game each night and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: A-League - Friday 31 January - KOGARAH Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St at Princes Hwy
properties.publicTransport: Match tickets include travel on public transport. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Brisbane Roar at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 7:30pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavy in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as crowds travel to and from the game during Friday evening peak.

Road closures will be in place from 4:30pm on the following roads around the stadium:

- Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St

- English St between the Princes Hwy and High St

- Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

roads.mainStreet: Jubilee Ave, English St and Park St

properties.headline: Fun Run - Saturday 16 February - RHODES TO OLYMPIC PARK Bennelong Bridge at Hill Rd
properties.publicTransport: Buses in Olympic Park will be affected. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 1,000 people are expected to participate in the annual Billbergia Bennelong Bridge Run from 7:15am to 10am.

Bennelong Bridge from Shoreline Dr and Waterways St will be closed from 5am to 10am along with sections of Waterways St, Wentworth St, Wentworth Pl and Shoreline Dr.

Sections of Hill Rd, Kevin Coombs Ave and the Holker Busway will close from 5am until 9am. Lane closures will be in place from 5am until 10am on sections of Jamieson St and Holker St. 

Detours around the closures will be via the P5 Loop Rd. Motorists travelling around Rhodes, Wentworth Point and Olympic Park should allow additional travel time, be aware of changed traffic conditions and increased pedestrian activity.

RHODES, OLYMPIC PARK AND WENTWORTH POINT

FROM 5AM UNTIL 10AM

properties.headline: Expo - Friday 7 to Sunday 9 February - BROADMEADOW Griffiths Rd, Chatham Rd approaching Newcastle Showground and Entertainment Centre
properties.publicTransport: Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the 2020 Caravan and Camping Expo at Newcastle Showground and Entertainment Centre in Broadmeadow from 9am to 5pm on Friday and Saturday, and 9am to 4pm on Sunday.

Motorists should allow extra travel time as traffic is expected to be heavier than normal on Griffiths Rd, Turton and Lambton Rd, particularly during Friday afternoon peak.

properties.headline: Street Festival - Saturday 8 February - WYONG Alison Rd and local roads at Pacific Hwy
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Love Lanes Festival at the Chapman Building in Wyong from 4pm to 9pm.

Local roads will close between 6am and 11pm including Robleys Ln, Alison Rd, Hely St, Bakers Ln, Peters Ln and Rankens Circuit. There will be no access to Alison Rd, Bakers Ln and Robleys Ln from the Pacific Hwy during this time. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual along the Pacific Hwy through Wyong while road closures are in place.

properties.headline: A-League - Sunday 2 February - GOSFORD Dane Dr between Central Coast Hwy AND Donnison St
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Central Coast Mariners v Western Sydney Wanderers at Central Coast Stadium from 4pm to 6pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than normal on the Central Coast Hwy, Pacific Hwy, Brisbane Water Dr, Donnison St and Mann St as fans travel to the game.

Dane Dr between Georgiana Terrace and Donnison St will close from 2pm and re-open once crowds have safely cleared the area.

Motorists should be aware of changed traffic conditions in the area before, during and after the game and follow instructions of traffic controllers on site.

properties.headline: Sun Run - Saturday 1 February - DEE WHY, CURL CURL, FRESHWATER, QUEENSCLIFF, MANLY The Strand, Griffin Rd, North Steyne & South Steyne
properties.publicTransport: Some buses will divert while roads are closed. Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.

arrangementAttachments.displayName: Road Closure & Clearway Map - Sun Run Sat 1 Feb
arrangementAttachments.linkName: Road Closure & Clearway Map - Sun Run Sat 1 Feb

properties.otherAdvice:
Over 6,000 people will take part in the 10th annual Sun Run starting at 6:45am from The Strand in Dee Why and finishing by 11am at North Steyne in Manly. Road closures, parking restrictions and changed traffic conditions will be in effect.

Road closures:

Dee Why - 4am to 9am: sections of Howard Ave, The Strand and Dee Why Pde. Two-way vehicle crossing of The Strand will be maintained at Pacific Pde until 6.30am.

North Curl Curl - 5:30am to 9am: Abbott Rd between Harbord Rd and Griffin Rd including local surrounding roads will be closed.

Dee Why to Queenscliff - 6am to 9am: sections of Griffin Rd, Carrington Pde, Evans St and Charles St. Two-way vehicle crossing of Griffin Rd will be maintained at Pitt Rd until 6.30am.

Queenscliff - 6am to 10am: sections of Queenscliff Rd, Undercliff Rd, Dalley St, Greycliffe St and Dowling St.

Two-way vehicle crossing of Charles St will be maintained at Moore Rd until 6.40am. One-way westbound crossing of Dowling St will be maintained at Crown Rd until 6.45am and from 9am to 10am. 

Manly - 4am to 11am: sections of North & South Steyne, Wentworth St and Raglan St. Access to Cameron Ave will be managed via Collingwood St from 6am until 9:30am.

Affected residents are advised to travel before or after the roads are closed as managed access will be limited or restricted. 

Special event clearways will be in effect along sections of The Strand, Harbord Rd and North Steyne from 4am until 9am. 

Clearways are strict no-parking zones, and apply even to local residents or RMS Mobility Scheme Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies.

arrangementElements.html:
Special event clearways are strict no parking zones even for local residents and RMS Mobility Scheme Parking Permit holders. Check signs carefully as vehicles left in clearways will be towed and a fee applies. If your car is towed, call 132 701 to find its new location.

DEE WHY/CURL CURL

FROM 4AM TO 9AM

  • The Strand between Dee Why Pde and Oaks Ave (both sides)
  • Harbord Rd between Abbott Rd and path to Greendale Creek (eastern side)
  • Harbord Rd between Milles St and Abbott Rd (western side)

QUEENSCLIFF

FROM 4AM TO 9AM

  • Crown Road between Cavill Street and Dowling Street (both sides)

MANLY

FROM 4AM TO 9AM

  • North Steyne between Collingwood Street and The Corso (eastern side)
  • North Steyne between The Corso and Raglan Street (both sides)
  • South Steyne between The Corso and Ashburner St (eastern side)
  • South Steyne between Victoria Pde and The Corso (western side)
arrangementElements.title: Special Event Clearways

arrangementElements.html:
DEE WHY

FROM 4AM TO 9AM

  • Dee Why Pde 1 between Clyde Rd and The Strand (both directions)
  • Howard Ave between Clyde Rd and The Strand (both directions)

  • The Strand 2 between Dee Why Pde and Pacific Pde (both directions)

Notes:

1. The closure will be implemented once Dee Why carpark is full

2. Vehicle crossover point at Oaks Ave until 6:30am.


NORTH CURL CURL

Notes:

2. Access to and from properties on the western side of Harbord Rd is one way northbound only. Southbound traffic will be diverted into a northbound lane under contra-flow traffic control.

Vehicle crossover point until 6:30am - After 6.30am there will be no vehicle crossing of The Strand as barriers will be implemented. Residents in streets east of The Strand from Oaks Ave to Pitt Rd will be unable to travel west of The Strand until 9am when the road is reopened.No driveway access to the Sports grounds along Abbott Rd between Harbord Rd and Griffin Rd while the westbound lanes of Abbott Rd are closed from 5.30am to 9am. Properties include Dee Why RSL Bowling Club, John Fisher Netball Courts, John Fisher Park (Denzil Joyce, Reub Hudson and Old Reub Hudson Ovals) and Abbott Rd Softball Ground.

DEE WHY / NORTH CURL CURL

Notes:

Vehicle crossover point until 6:30am only - Roads located between the event route and the coast will not have vehicular access between 6:30am and 9am.

MANLY

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Sydney FC v Western Sydney Wanderers at Netstrata Jubilee Stadium from 5pm.

Traffic is expected to be heavy in both directions on the Princes Hwy approaching Kogarah as large crowds travel to and from the Sydney Derby. 

Road closures will be in place before the game on the following roads around the stadium:

- Jubilee Ave between the Princes Hwy and Park St

- English St between the Princes Hwy and High St

- Park St between Jubilee Ave and English St

Roads will re-open an hour after full-time or once crowds have cleared the area.

properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Western Sydney Wanderers v Newcastle Jets at Bankwest Stadium from 7:30pm. 

Traffic may be heavier than usual on O'Connell St, Parramatta Rd, Church St, Victoria Rd, James Ruse Dr and Pennant Hills Rd as large crowds travel to the stadium. Motorists should plan to arrive early and allow extra travel time.

Roads around the stadium may close prior to full-time and reopen once crowds have safely cleared the precinct including:

  • O’Connell St from Grose St to George St
  • Ross St from O’Connell St to Trott St
  • Victoria Rd from O’Connell St to Villiers St

Motorists are advised to allow extra travel time and detour around the closures via Parkes St, Harris St, Macarthur St and Isabella St or Victoria Rd instead to avoid delays.

properties.headline: Music Festival - Saturday 15 February - POKOLBIN McDonalds Rd at Broke Rd
properties.otherAdvice:
Large crowds are expected to attend the Red Hot Summer Tour at the Roche Estate in the Hunter Valley from 1pm until 9:30pm. 

Motorists should allow extra travel time on Wine Country Dr, McDonalds Rd and Broke Rd approaching the site.

Fans using the Hunter Expressway can exit at the Branxton Interchange and use Wine Country Dr and then either McDonalds Rd or Broke Rd to access the event.

properties.headline: Music Festival - Sunday 2 February - SYDNEY CBD Art Gallery Rd, Mrs Macquaries Rd & Hospital Rd approaching The Domain
properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 20,000 people are expected to attend the St Jerome's Laneway music festival from 11am to 11pm at the Domain Sydney. 

From 8:30pm to 11:15pm Art Gallery Rd will be closed and from 9:30pm to 11:15pm sections of Mrs Macquaries Rd, St Marys Rd, Prince Albert Rd, Hospital Rd and Cathedral St will be closed.

Motorists should allow extra travel time, be aware of increased pedestrian activity and use alternative routes while closures are in place.

arrangementElements.html:

FROM 8:30PM TO 11:15PM

FROM 9:30PM TO 11:15PM

  • Prince Albert Rd from Macquarie St to Art Gallery Rd
  • Hospital Rd from Art Gallery Rd to Shakespeare Pl (access will be managed for emergency vehicles only)

properties.publicTransport: Visit transportnsw.info to plan your trip.
properties.otherAdvice:
A-League: Newcastle Jets v Western United at McDonald Jones Stadium from 5pm to 7pm.

Traffic may be heavier than normal on Turton Rd, Griffiths Rd, Newcastle Rd, Lambton Rd and Bridges Rd through Broadmeadow as large crowds travel to and from the stadium.

Motorists should allow extra travel time and be aware of increased pedestrian activity on local roads.

webLinks.linkText: Lunar New Year Twilight Parade - Chatswood

properties.headline: Street Parade - Saturday 8 February - CHATSWOOD Victoria Ave, Endeavour St and Bertram St
properties.publicTransport: Buses to and from Chatswood Interchange will be diverting and missing stops on Victoria Ave from 5:30pm until 8:30pm. Plan your trip at transportnsw.info.
properties.otherAdvice:
Thousands of people are expected to attend the Lunar New Year Twilight Parade in Chatswood CBD from 6:30pm until 7:30pm.

Traffic will be heavy on Boundary St, Pacific Hwy, Mowbray Rd, Penshurst St, Archer St, Victoria Ave and Albert Ave approaching Chatswood. Motorists should allow plenty of additional travel time.

Road closures will be in place from 5:30pm until 8:30pm to accommodate the event: 

  • Victoria Ave between Anderson St and Neridah St
  • Anderson St between Help St and Albert Ave
  • Bertram St between Victoria Ave and Albert Ave
  • Archer St between Ferguson Lane and Albert Ave
  • Endeavour St
  • Charlotte Ln
  • Orchard Rd

No entry or exit from the Westfield car park on Anderson St during the closure period. Access to the Westfield car park is remains available via Albert Ave and Victor St.

Chatswood Chase car park access via Malvern Ave and Neridah St is unaffected however delays are expected.

roads.mainStreet: Victoria Ave, Endeavour St and Bertram St

properties.headline: Triathlon - Saturday 8 February - JINDABYNE TO CHARLOTTE PASS various roads incl Kosciuszko Rd and Alpine Way
properties.otherAdvice:
Up to 150 participants along with support vehicles will take part in the Australia Alpine Ascent from Jindabyne to Charlotte Pass from 6am until 5pm.

Changed traffic conditions including reduced speed limits and short term closures will be in place along the following roads:

  • Kosciuszko Rd from Kalkite Rd to Alpine Way from 7am until 12pm
  • Alpine Way from Kosciuszko Rd to Dead Horse Gap from 8am until 11:30am
  • Kosciuszko Rd from Alpine Way to Summit Rd from 10:30am until 5pm.

Traffic controllers will be on site along the course to assist with the movement of traffic and participants during the event.

Motorists should expect some delays, exercise caution and follow the direction of traffic control.

roads.mainStreet: various roads incl Kosciuszko Rd and Alpine Way

properties.headline: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS Summer Holiday Period - SHOALHAVEN Naval College Rd, Booderee Ave, Cyrus St at Northern Hyams Beach
properties.otherAdvice:
Changed traffic conditions and speed reductions are in place approaching Hyams Beach including one-way roads at the northern end of Hyams Beach to manage the heavy traffic over the busy summer holiday period until 27 January.

  • A temporary roundabout will be in operation at the corner of Naval College Rd and Booderee Ave from 7am to 6pm daily.
  • Speed reduction from 80km/h to 40km/h will be in effect along Naval College Rd approaching Booderee Ave in both directions.
  • One way traffic changes will be in place on Tulip St (northbound only), Cyrus St (southbound only), Bamboo Ave (westbound only) and Anemone Ave (eastbound only).

If Hyams Beach reaches capacity, or in the event of a catastrophic fire danger rating, temporary closures at Naval College Rd and Booderee Ave will be implemented.

Motorists should arrive early or expect significant delays on roads approaching the township and beach during this period. Alternative white sand beaches can be found at Website: Shoalhaven – South Coast NSW
properties.displayName: CHANGED TRAFFIC CONDITIONS Summer Holiday Period

roads.mainStreet: Naval College Rd, Booderee Ave, Cyrus St

webLinks.linkText: NSW National Parks & Wildlife Service - Royal National Park local alerts

properties.headline: Royal National Park - Saturday 25 to Monday 27 January - ROYAL NATIONAL PARK McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads at Princes Hwy
properties.otherAdvice:
The Royal National Park is typically very busy during the Australia Day long weekend from Saturday 25 to Monday 27 January.

Road closures will be implemented as precincts and car parks reach full at Wattamolla Beach, Garie Beach, Audley, Maianbar and Bundeena.

If parking capacity is reached across all precincts, traffic will only be permitted to travel through the park. If there are significant delays, both the northern and southern entries to the park via Farnell Ave at Loftus and via Lady Wakehurst Dr at Otford will close. Entry will be maintained via McKell Ave at Waterfall for residents only. 

Visitors are encouraged to check the Royal National Park local alerts before travelling for updates on precinct access. Walking trails may also be closed due to fire bans and/or risks so plan ahead. 

Road closures when precincts reach capacity:

  • Wattamolla Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Wattamolla Beach
  • Garie Rd between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Garie Beach
  • Maianbar Rd between Bundeena Dr and Maianbar township
  • Bundeena Dr between Sir Bertram Stevens Dr and Bundeena township

Traffic controllers and NSW Police will be on-site managing access for local residents on Maianbar Rd and Bundeena Dr upon proof of residential address.
properties.displayName: Royal National Park - Saturday 25 to Monday 27 January

roads.mainStreet: McKell Ave, Farnell Ave and various roads
